moves.1. c4: c4, my favourite, though not exclusive
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 e5 3. d3 d5 4. cxd5 Nxd5: And this is one of my favourite situations too. I still don't know why, because it is not even clear white is or not better.
moves.10... Qf6: and this is a first surprise. I guess c3 is in the goals.
moves.11. O-O: here, i guess i was exposed on e4 followed by dxe and Qxc3.
moves.15. Qxa7 e4 16. Nd4: as Nc6 is no more, e4 has no more the same effect.
moves.16... exd3: many possibilities, but I think my solution is the best one
moves.17. Rxb7 Rba8: unexpected, I must admit, but still no harm
moves.18. Qc5 dxe2 19. Re1 Rxa2 20. Rxc7 Re8 2: doubble effect: Bh5 has no more harm and K can now move to e2
moves.21... h6: I thought something like a kNight move would have occurred. But no, then...
moves.22... Rxe2 23. Nxe2 Bg6 24. Kf2 Qe6: threatening some knight move, I guess... But there is no peculiar harm...
moves.25. Qc4: please do exchange: my c pawn is free...
moves.25... Nd5: No sir. But I will attack on e2
moves.26... Qf5 27. Rc5 Qd3: big mistake. Next moves are forced.
moves.29... Nxc3: taking back the pawn for the price...
I'll have my exchange at last
